Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Create artifacts for sharing NuGetGallery.Services" (#8962) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I did a feasibility spike on getting this project's artifacts into a nupkg for broader use, and got it working using a nupkg stub workaround with built assets (the same approach used for the jobs projects in the same buildstep).

Note that using the `New-ProjectPackage` PS function for this was a dead end, as this project is not SDK-style (the projects in the repo that do use this function are all SDK-style). The msbuild error there is that the `pack` target is not defined, and this target comes built in to SDK-style projects. Converting the Services project into an SDK-style project is also non-trivial as it turns out, so that can possibly be future work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[WIKI TYPO] Typo in "Branding the NuGet Gallery"" (#9113) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

There is a typo in the "Branding the NuGet Gallery" wiki.

In the [Clone The Gallery](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/wiki/Branding-the-NuGet-Gallery#clone-the-gallery) section in point 3 you are missing a "h" in the URL, the URL is https://gitub.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery.git but should be https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery.git

Cheers

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[WIKI TYPO] Typo in "Branding the NuGet Gallery"" (#9113) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

There is a typo in the "Branding the NuGet Gallery" wiki.

Cheers

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Default into 2FA upon new user sign up" (#6858) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Once a new user sign's up using MSA, 2FA should be enabled. Users can disable if they wanted to.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Many SPDX license Expressions not resolved by https://licenses.nuget.org/ instead "We have no information regarding the 'Xyz' license."" (#9097) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

dotnet 

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. create a Visual Studio Project Nuget Package with an SPDX Expression e.g. <PackageLicenseExpression>Hippocratic-2.1</PackageLicenseExpression>
2. build, pack and push the Package using an Azure pipeline 
3. Visit the Package Feed / Artifact Page in Azure 
4. Search for the new Package 
5. Click the Project License Link in the bottom right Corner which links to https://licenses.nuget.org/Hippocratic-2.1 
6. Get an Error Message: We have no information regarding the 'Hippocratic-2.1' license. 

The https://spdx.org/licenses/ Page lists many licenses, 
but it seems only a few work, e.g. MIT, MIT-0, LGPL-2.0-only and MPL-1.0 

Many Licenses listed on https://spdx.org/licenses/  don't work and the link https://licenses.nuget.org/Hippocratic-2.1 displays a page with an error message reading "We have no information regarding the 'Hippocratic-2.1' license."

I understand that maintaining the full List is a lot of work, but it would be good to at least 
* include a Link to the SPDX License https://spdx.org/licenses/Hippocratic-2.1.html 
* or a Link the List https://spdx.org/licenses/ 
in the Message when it cannot be found on https://licenses.nuget.org  

Best Regards...

### Verbose Logs

```shell
https://licenses.nuget.org/Hippocratic-2.1 does not link to or mirror 
https://spdx.org/licenses/Hippocratic-2.1
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[README] "Blockquotes" is using a larger font size, and the distance between rows is too large" (#8505) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Repro: Test package: https://int.nugettest.org/packages/license-expression-test2 Add this blockquotes into a readme file: ``` line 1 line 2 line 3 > quote1 >> quote 2 >>> quote 3 > quote 4 line 4 line 5 ``` The package detail page shows: Could the rendering be better?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Special case packages that use ``-dev`` suffixes as always being the latest version of the package." (#11803) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI, Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

.NET SDK: 7.0.100-preview.5.22229.2, MSBuild (From Visual Studio and .NET SDK), Visual Studio: 17.2 Preview 6

### Worked before?

Nope

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

This thing annoys me that nuget always considers ``-dev`` as an downgrade for ``-preview.*``, or ``-beta.*`` packages when they are not (because they are local builds).

Consider the following:
- Project A references EFCore.SqlServer and an local build of Microsoft.Data.SqlClient (5.0.0-dev)
  - EFCore.SqlServer references Microsoft.Data.SqlClient (5.0.0-preview.2)

In this case it warns (or errors) even though technically my local build is newer than what 5.0.0-preview.2 provides.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
It should be easy to reproduce my creating an new library project (A) that then adds an package reference to EFCore.SqlServer, and then to an local build of Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[Bug]: dotnet list [projet | solution] package does not work with solution filters" (#11789) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.202

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

`dotnet restore` works with [solution filters](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/msbuild/solution-filters?view=vs-2022).

`dotnet list solution.slnf package --vulnerable` fails with

```
error: Parameter "xml" cannot be null.

Usage: NuGet.CommandLine.XPlat.dll package list [arguments] [options]
```

Not sure if this is a bug or a feature that has not been implemented.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
dotnet list solution.slnf package --vulnerable

The following sources were used:
   https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
   C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\

error: Parameter "xml" cannot be null.


Usage: NuGet.CommandLine.XPlat.dll package list [arguments] [options]

Arguments:
  <PROJECT | SOLUTION>  A path to a project, solution file or directory.

Options:
  -h|--help               Show help information
  --force-english-output  Forces the application to run using an invariant, English-based culture.
  --framework             Specifies the target framework for which the packages will be listed.
  --deprecated            Displays only the packages marked deprecated by the authors.
  --outdated              Displays only the packages that need updates with the latest version from the sources.
  --vulnerable            Displays only the packages flagged as vulnerable.
  --include-transitive    Includes transitive packages too in the result.
  --include-prerelease    Considers prerelease versions when looking for latest. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --highest-patch         Considers only the versions with matching minor and major. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --highest-minor         Considers only the versions with matching major. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --source                Sources to lookup for latest versions. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --config                A path to a config file to specify sources. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --interactive           Allow the command to block and require manual action for operations like authentication.
  -v|--verbosity          Set the verbosity level of the command. Allowed values are q[uiet], m[inimal], n[ormal], d[etailed], and diag[nostic].
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: global.json reader fails to parse file with anything but a leading StartObject (curly brace)" (#11784) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

17.2.0

### Worked before?

Yes, 17.1

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

Use a `global.json` with a leading comment or not a `{`:

```jsonc
// A comment
{
  "msbuild-sdks": {
    "Microsoft.Build.NoTargets" : "3.3.0"
  }
}
```

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/92f7c1cd472d6a47dde580baab4a455350c9d2ac/src/NuGet.Core/Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver/GlobalJsonReader.cs#L164-L167

### Workaround
Remove any leading tokens that are not a JSON `{`

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: The Latest Stable version does not show in the "Version" dropdown box after installing a package with not the latest version in “Updates” tab" (#11802) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.1.0.65

### Worked before?

Dev\6.1.0.64

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

## Repro steps:  
1. Create a C# Console App (.NET core) project via VS.
2. Open PM UI of the project by right clicking the project->Manage NuGet Packages… in Solution Explorer.
3. Install a package (e.g. Newtonsoft.json) into the project with not the latest version in “Browse” tab.
4. Switch to the “Update” tab and observe the “version” dropdown box.
## Expected:
The Latest Stable version should show in the "Version" dropdown box in “Updates” tab as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/167382210-fb22f501-d939-4b55-b829-c0cef045cc9a.png)
## Actual: 
The installed version shows in the "Version" dropdown box in “Updates” tab as below screenshot. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/167382264-80ea98ca-f41e-42c0-85bb-51aa1724324a.png)
## Note:
1. This issue starts to repro on Dev\6.1.0.65.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: `SecurePluginCredentialProvider.GetAsync` calls `GetAuthenticationCredentialsRequest` wrong" (#11801) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet SDK

### Product Version

Any version

### Worked before?

No

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

I wrote at length about this issue in https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/issues/2715

At time I was asking about documentation mismatch between caller and callee. It was answered I should look at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/extensibility/nuget-cross-platform-plugins for documentation which states:
> If present, indicates that this attempt is a retry of a previously failed attempt. Providers typically use this flag to ensure that they bypass any existing cache and prompt for new credentials if possible.

Hence I'm opening issue that `SecurePluginCredentialProvider.GetAsync` is setting wrong value for `isRetry` parameter on `GetAuthenticationCredentialsRequest`.

Until this is fixed, multiple calls to authenticated feed is/will be broken.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Allow for viewing readme when package not hosted on nuget.org" (#11800) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:

I have a nuget package hosted in a private repository (Aerion Devops Artifacts). It would be good to be able to view the readme file in Visual Studio that is embedded in my nuget package.

### Additional Context and Details

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Package Newtonsoft.json install fails with NU3008" (#11791) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
GET https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/index.json
  GET https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/system.data.sqlclient/index.json
  OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/index.json 202ms

  OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/system.data.sqlclient/index.json 215ms

  OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/13.0.1/newtonsoft.json.13.0.1.nupkg 46ms
  OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/system.data.sqlclient/4.8.3/system.data.sqlclient.4.8.3.nupkg 99ms
Package 'Newtonsoft.Json 13.0.1' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PackageDownload multiple versions doesn't work in Visual Studio. " (#11798) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Originally changed in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/ef9eb47e886cd5abe7e5d3160cc48312274b1c06, works on the commandline, but doesn't work in VS. 

Bug here: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/f52a83999070237288d7e1c8ec5934a65eda77ac/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.SolutionRestoreManager/VSNominationUtilities.cs#L123

Example failure: 

> Severity Code Description Project File Line Suppression State
Error NU1105 Unable to read project information for 'EntityDesignBootstrapPackage': '[5.0.0];[6.2.0]' is not a valid version string. EntityDesignBootstrapPackage C:\dev\ef6tools\src\EFTools\EntityDesignBootstrapPackage\EntityDesignBootstrapPackage.csproj 1

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org" (#61) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: We announced plans to require tFA on all accounts on NuGet.org. Details in the [blog post](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/requiring-two-factor-authentication-on-nuget-org/).
